Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery krater. Inside glazed; outside, below, maeander band; above, to left, leg of table and of kline, with some drapery; to right, foot and dress of female hastening to right; her dress is in creamy white, the foot in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1147)
